metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35498 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in openvswitch. A limitation in the implementation of userspace packet parsing can allow a malicious user to send a specially crafted packet causing the resulting megaflow in the kernel to be too wide, potentially causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-pki - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-source - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-switch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-test - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
openvswitch-vtep - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
python3-openvswitch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.4').
